text:
In this video, we'll cover
how to screen-share on Discord
for both desktop and mobile.

Before screen-sharing,
head to your settings
to adjust a few options.
On "Voice & Video," you can select
your input devices for microphone audio
and output to determine if the audio plays

through speakers,
headphones, or other devices.

For your mic, you can also
choose "Push to Talk,"

where you can only speak when
holding a specific button,

or "Voice Activity," which
will automatically detect

when you're speaking and
share in the voice chat.
To start screen-sharing in a voice chat,

connect to the chat and
look next to your username.
You should see two options,
one for video and one to screen-share.
Clicking "Screen" will bring you
to the source-selection page,

where you'll be able to choose
the windowed application
you want to share with the chat.

Or tab over to "Screens" to
share your whole desktop view.
And then "Go Live" to begin streaming.

Your stream preview will appear
in a small movable window.

Click on it to bring
your preview full screen.

Or click the cog icon to
change stream resolution
and frame-rate settings.
Click "Stop Streaming" once done sharing.
To screen-share in the mobile app,
join a voice or a video chat.
In the call, a screen-share prompt
will appear on the bottom.
Click the prompt and, if asked,

grant Discord permission
to share your screen.
Confirm that, and you'll start streaming
your mobile view to the chat.
